intro: Calceolaria filicaulis subsp. luxurians, commonly known as the showy calceolaria, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its striking, hooded flowers that come in a range of colors, including red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in cool, moist environments and prefers well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and shaded borders in horticulture.
